description: Multiple Choice Questions from the IMT3004 exam 2020. Use for practice and self-testing.

questions.question: What should be done first in an organization that wants to start an incident response planning process?
choices: Decide on the CSIRT organizational model
Develop an IR plan
Create IR procedures
Integrate the BIA

questions.question: What comes first of these actions in the incident handling life cycle?
choices: Vulnerability report
Obtain contact information
Incident analysis
Triage

questions.question: Which TLP marking should be used for sharing information that requires support to be effectively acted upon, but carries risk to privacy, reputation, or operations if shared outside of the organizations involved?
choices: TLP WHITE
TLP GREEN
TLP AMBER
TLP RED

questions.question: What can organisations do to avoid becoming part of the problem and misused as reflectors in DDoS attacks on others?
choices: Monitor BGP traffic to detect IP hijacking
Stress-test own infrastructure to determine bottle-necks
Scan for misconfigured, abusable services in own network
Monitor DDoS backscatter traffic in darknets

questions.question: What is the most important step you can do to prepare to respond to a ransomware incident?
choices: Coordinating with Internet Service Provider
User awareness programs
Maintain functional offline backups
Use antivirus software

questions.question: How can passive DNS be used in incident response?
choices: For threat hunting, pivoting indicators of compromise
For sharing of indicators between CSIRTs to implement better IDS signatures
For threat intelligence, learning the attackers TTPs
As a sandbox for dynamic malware analysis

questions.question: In what phase in the intrusion kill chain model will a NIDPS usually detect an intrusion?
choices: Reconnaissance
Weaponization
Installation
Command and Control

questions.question: Under what circumstances does the GDPR allow CSIRTS to share indicators of compromise containing personal data?
choices: Only if the indicators are properly anonymized
Domains and IP addresses can be shared, but no identifying information such as user names and email addresses
Only if the processing of data constitutes a legitimate interest of the data controller
GDPR prevents the possibility of sharing indicators containing personal data between CSIRTS

questions.question: What is the distinction between an ATT&CK technique and an IOC?
choices: Many of the ATT&CK techniques described are legitimate system functions, while IOCs are typically associated with adversary actions
ATT&CK techniques cannot be used as input to intrusion detection signatures
IOCs have less utility for defenders
IOCs are less dependent on specific malware or hacker tools

questions.question: What is DETT&CT?
choices: An update to ATT&CK, developed by MITRE
A framework assisting blue teams to map their detection coverage to ATT&CK techniques and tactics
A scoring system for implementation of ATT&CK IDS signatures
The red team version of ATT&CK
